section.title: Project Files
section.para: This window is displayed automatically when OmegaT loads a project. It can also be called at any time by selecting in the menu.
The window displays the following information:

listitem.para: The total number of translatable files in the project, which are the files in the folder in a format recognized by OmegaT. This number is displayed in parentheses in the window title.
The list of all translatable files in the project.
The file list entries include the name, filter type, encoding and number of segments of the file
The total number of segments, the number of unique segments in the entire project, and the number of unique segments already translated are shown at the bottom of the file list.

section.para:
You can:
click on any file to open it for translation in the ,
select a file using the Up and Down keys,
type a string to filter the list on files with that string in their name,
sort the files by clicking on any of the column headers,
select one or more files in the list and, use one of the Move... buttons on reorder the selected file or files,
right-click on a filename to open a context menu from which you can open the source file and (if it exists) the target file, or
use CRight-click to open their location.
The number of unique segments is calculated by taking all segments and subtracting all duplicate segments.

warning.para: Modifying the segmentation rules will modify the number of segments and unique segments.

section.para: The difference between the "Number of segments" and "Number of unique segments" gives an approximate idea of the number of repetitions in the text. The file located in the folder of your project contains more detailed segment information, broken down by source file.
The Copy Files To Source Folder and the Download MediaWiki Page buttons perform the same function as the equivalent item in the menu.

note.para: It is possible to stop the window from displaying automatically by setting the project_files_show_on_load option to false in .
